hasBeenPublishedBy.schema:legalName: Maison Départementale du Tourisme de la Haute-Marne

de:
Nogent, dieser Name, der auf die Klingen von Scheren und Messern geschrieben ist, wird oft mit Nogent-sur-Marne und Nogent-sur-Seine verwechselt.
Der einzige der 17 Nogent von Frankreich, der keinen Zusatz zu seinem Namen hat, ist dieser Nogent von Haute Marne, weltberühmt und noch so wenig bekannt.
Der ursprüngliche Name von Nogent war von sehr alter Herkunft und lautete NOVIO oder NOIO. NOIUM wurde lateinisch und erzeugte nacheinander die französischen Wörter NOIANT, NOIGENT und NOGENT.
en:
Nogent, this name inscribed on the blades of scissors and knives is often confused with Nogent-sur-Marne and Nogent-sur-Seine.
The only one of the 17 Nogent of France which have no additive to its name is this Nogent of Haute Marne, world famous and still so little known.
Of very old origin, the primitive name of Nogent was NOVIO or NOIO which became NOIUM in Latin and produced successively the French words : NOIANT, NOIGENT and NOGENT.
In 1235, after Champagne was included into the kingdom of France, we found the name of “NOGENT LE ROI” which persist until the revolution of 1789.
In 1793 we delated “LE ROI”. The commune is called since then NOGENT HAUTE - MARNE.
At the Restoration we take back the name of NOGENT LE ROI but the confusion being real with NOGENT LE ROI in Eure and Loir, the general council of Haute Marne proposes in 1890 : NOGENT EN BASSIGNY.
However, NOGENT is not located in the Bassigny, area of High east bovine breeding Slogged. This mistake will only be corrected in 1972. The regrouping with the small communes of Donnemarie, Essey les Eaux and Odival then gives the municipality of NOGENT.

In the Middle Ages, Nogent was an important stronghold. In the writings we find mention of his castle.
We observe very well this typical medieval site where the population was fixed essentially along the valley of the Traire and came, in case of danger, to take refuge in the castle located 100 m higher.

A succession of lords resides there until 1234 when Thibaut V Count of Champagne wanted to monopolize the whole region. Especially as having no fortress to defend his domains on the East border, the castle of Nogent was interesting.
After four years of fighting, Renier IV Lord of Nogent succumbed to an attack and his sons signed a transaction in 1235 by which they gave up the castle and lands to the Count of Champagne ; as the latter, previous year, had inherited the kingdom of Navarre, Nogent was then called Nogent le Roi. He entrusted the guard of the castle to a governor. He loved Nogent, whom he often came to visit.
He freed the inhabitants in June 1235.
During the hundred years’war, the Anglo-Burgundians seized the city. In 1486, following wars and plague, there were only 92 families in Nogent.
When Richelieu came to power with Louis XIII, he made destroy most of the fortresses. But the Castle of Nogent escaped destruction. The order of demolition was removed on condition that the inhabitants take care to maintain it under the command of a governor named by the King.
Ramparts still existed at the beginning of the XVIII century, at the same time, the population increased around the castle in the upper town.
But as there was no more maintenance, the Castle collapsed, or we took care  to collapse it and get back stones to build the neighboring houses. There remains only ruins (pieces of ramparts). The tower still visible today is a corner tower rebuilt in the XIX. 
Nogent is the seat of a provost of the bailiwick of Chaumont.
The cutlery, appeared around 1650, quickly acquires a big fame. This industry develops in XVIII benefiting from an influx of cutlers Langrois forced to become established in more than 4 places of the episcopal city.
The cutlery city participates at the revolution. From 1793, sabers and bayonets are manufactured. On this occasion,  saint Germain's church  was transformed into a saber factory for the needs of the cause.
In the nineteenth century this industry (knives, scissors, hand tools, surgical instruments ...) reached its peak and 6000 workers form the Nogentais area settling along watercourses (Traire, Marne, Rognon, Meuse...). The population increases which explains the reconstruction of the church Saint Jean inaugurated in 1865.
But the war of 1870 will wreak havoc from 06 to 13 December. 60 burned houses, 500 people without asylum in winter. The bruised city, decides to erect a monument to the victims fallen on its territory immortalized by Bernard Dimey in his poem the Childhood.
From 1850, companies are created. Structural changes occur in the most important factories. They simultaneously concern specialization, the division of labor and mechanization.
 The justice of Peace replaces the provostship and settles in a door of the old castle until 1958.
During the  Great war of 1914-1918 many women replace the men left at the front and some factories make the armament.
 From the twentieth century, cutlery and scissors evolve to factories forging parts for the automobile, surgery, agricultural equipment ...
Today, tradition and innovation, the hand of man and robots coexist in companies. The high-end cutlery produces luxury items distributed around the world. As for high technology, it supplies large-scale production of weapons, automobiles, aviation, agricultural machinery, prostheses and implants and surgical equipment on the French and foreign markets.
Nogent small town of 4000 inhabitants is 12 km from the A5 and A31 motorways. In a wooded area, quiet and green it is more than 3 hours from Paris, Lyon and Germany.
it:
Di origine molto antica (Neolitico). Nel Medioevo, Nogent era un importante feudo. Una successione di signori risiedette nel suo castello fino al 1234, quando Thibaut IV conte di Champagne prese possesso del castello e delle sue terre. Nel giugno 1235 liberò gli abitanti

Nel 1285, Nogent e la regione della Champagne entrarono a far parte del dominio reale

Durante la Guerra dei Cento Anni (1337-1453), gli Anglo-Burgundi si impadronirono della città. Nel 1486, a causa delle guerre e della peste, a Nogent erano rimaste solo 92 famiglie

Quando Richelieu salì al potere con Luigi XIII, fece distruggere la maggior parte delle fortezze, lasciando agli abitanti il castello di Nogent.  

I bastioni esistevano ancora all'inizio del XVIII secolo. La torre ancora oggi visibile è una torre d'angolo ricostruita nel XIX secolo.

L'industria delle posate, apparsa intorno al 1650, divenne rapidamente molto famosa.
 
Durante la guerra del 1914-1918, molte donne sostituirono gli uomini partiti per il fronte e alcune fabbriche produssero armi

Alla fine del XIX secolo la popolazione era di 3428 abitanti.

La tradizionale attività di coltelleria e cesellatura, che era all'origine della fama del bacino di Nogentais, ha progressivamente ceduto il passo a nuove produzioni come parti di automobili, aeronautica, utensili speciali per catene di montaggio, dispositivi medici, protesi?

Il Pôle Technologique Sud-Champagne dispone di un incubatore di imprese.

Ha avviato un programma di formazione per ingegneri con l'Université de Technologie de Troyes (UTT), con specializzazione in "Implementazione di processi e materiali".

Per rispondere in modo ancora più ampio alle esigenze delle aziende locali, e in particolare delle PMI, dal 2015 la filiale UTT ha istituito una laurea professionale. "È un corso che completa quello di ingegneria e risponde anche alle esigenze delle aziende che cercano questo tipo di competenze" (Fréderic Sanchette, sede di Nogent dell'UTT).

Nel 2018 abbiamo festeggiato il centesimo ingegnere e il quinto dottorato.

Questo centro di innovazione fornisce un forte supporto tecnologico al bacino industriale
La regione è stata riconosciuta da French Tech nella rete Health Tech
fr:
D’origine fort ancienne (Néolithique). Au Moyen-Age, Nogent était un fief important. Une succession de seigneurs réside dans son château jusqu’en 1234, où Thibaut IV comte de Champagne s’accapare du château et de ses terres. Il en affranchit les habitants en juin 1235. 

En 1285, Nogent avec la Champagne est intégré au domaine royal. 

Durant la guerre de 100 ans (1337-1453), les Anglo-Bourguignons s’emparèrent de la ville. En 1486, par suite des guerres et de la peste il n’y avait plus à Nogent que 92 familles. 

Quand Richelieu arriva au pouvoir avec Louis XIII, il fit détruire la plupart des forteresses laissant le château de Nogent aux habitants à charge pour eux de l’entretenir.  

Les remparts existaient encore au début du XVIIIe siècle. La tour visible encore aujourd’hui est une tour d’angle rebâtie au XIXe siècle.

La coutellerie, apparue vers 1650 acquiert rapidement une grande renommée.
 
Durant la guerre de 1914-1918 de nombreuses femmes remplacent les hommes partis au front et certaines usines fabriquent de l’armement. 

Fin XIXe siècle la population est de 3428 habitants.

L’activité traditionnelle de coutellerie et cisellerie artisanale à l’origine du renom du Bassin Nogentais, cède progressivement la place à de nouvelles productions telles que pièces automobiles, aéronautique, outils spéciaux pour les chaines de montage, dispositifs médicaux, prothèses…

Le Pôle Technologique Sud-Champagne réunit une pépinière d’entreprises.

Il a mis en place avec l’Université de Technologie de Troyes (UTT) une formation d’ingénieurs par apprentissage, spécialité « Procédés et Mise en Œuvre des Matériaux ».

Pour répondre encore plus largement aux besoins des entreprises locales, et en particulier des PME, l’antenne de l’UTT a mis en place une licence professionnelle depuis 2015. « C’est une formation qui est complémentaire à celle d’ingénieur et qui répond également aux besoins des entreprises qui recherchent ce type de compétences » (Fréderic Sanchette, antenne de Nogent de l’UTT).

Nous avons fêté en 2018 le centième ingénieur et le cinquième Docteur.

Ce centre d’innovation apporte un fort soutien technologique au bassin industriel. 
Le territoire a été reconnu par la French Tech dans le réseau thématique Santé (Health Tech)
nl:
Nogent, deze naam op de bladen van scharen en messen wordt vaak verward met Nogent-sur-Marne en Nogent-sur-Seine.
De enige van de 17 Nogent van Frankrijk die geen toevoeging aan zijn naam heeft, is deze Nogent van Haute Marne, wereldberoemd en nog zo weinig bekend.
Van zeer oude oorsprong was de oorspronkelijke naam van Nogent NOVIO of NOIO die NOIUM werd in het Latijn en achtereenvolgens de Franse woorden produceerde: NOIANT, NOIGENT en NOGENT.
es:
De origen muy antiguo (neolítico). En la Edad Media, Nogent era un feudo importante. Una sucesión de señores residió en su castillo hasta 1234, cuando Thibaut IV, conde de Champaña, se hizo con el castillo y sus tierras. En junio de 1235, liberó a los habitantes

En 1285, Nogent y la región de Champaña pasan a formar parte del dominio real

Durante la Guerra de los Cien Años (1337-1453), los anglo-burgueses tomaron la ciudad. En 1486, a consecuencia de las guerras y la peste, sólo quedaban 92 familias en Nogent

Cuando Richelieu llegó al poder con Luis XIII, hizo destruir la mayoría de las fortalezas, dejando el castillo de Nogent a los habitantes para que lo mantuvieran.  

Las murallas aún existían a principios del siglo XVIII. La torre que aún es visible hoy en día es una torre de esquina reconstruida en el siglo XIX.

La industria de la cuchillería, que apareció alrededor de 1650, se hizo rápidamente muy famosa.
 
Durante la guerra de 1914-1918, muchas mujeres sustituyeron a los hombres que habían partido al frente y algunas fábricas fabricaron armas

A finales del siglo XIX la población era de 3.428 habitantes.

La actividad tradicional de la cuchillería y el cincelado, que estuvo en el origen de la notoriedad de la cuenca del Nogentais, dio paso progresivamente a nuevas producciones como piezas de automóvil, aeronáutica, herramientas especiales para cadenas de montaje, dispositivos médicos, prótesis..

El Pôle Technologique Sud-Champagne cuenta con un vivero de empresas.

Ha puesto en marcha un programa de formación de aprendices para ingenieros con la Universidad de Tecnología de Troyes (UTT), especializado en "Implementación de procesos y materiales".

Para responder aún más ampliamente a las necesidades de las empresas locales, y en particular de las PYME, la sucursal de la UTT ha creado un grado profesional desde 2015. "Es un curso que complementa al de ingeniería y que también responde a las necesidades de las empresas que buscan este tipo de competencias" (Fréderic Sanchette, delegación de Nogent de la UTT).

En 2018, celebramos el ingeniero número cien y el quinto doctorado.

Este centro de innovación proporciona un fuerte apoyo tecnológico a la cuenca industrial
La región ha sido reconocida por French Tech en la red Health Tech
